dt: {bc}a word, {d_link|affix|affix:2}, or name usually indicating small size {bc}a diminutive {dx_def}see {dxt|diminutive:2||1}{/dx_def} word, affix, or name
{bc}one that is notably small {bc}a diminutive individual

et: Middle English {it}diminutif{/it}, from Medieval Latin {it}diminutivum{/it}, alteration of Late Latin {it}deminutivum{/it}, from neuter of {it}deminutivus{/it}, adjective, from {it}deminutus{/it}, past participle of {it}deminuere{/it} "to lessen" {ma}{mat|diminish|}{/ma}
shortdef: a word, affix, or name usually indicating small size : a diminutive word, affix, or name
one that is notably small : a diminutive individual

dt: {bc}indicating small size and sometimes the state or quality of being familiarly known, lovable, pitiable, or contemptible

used of affixes (such as {it}-ette, -kin, -ling{/it}) and of words formed with them (such as {it}kitchenette, manikin, duckling{/it}), of clipped forms (such as {it}Jim{/it}), and of altered forms (such as {it}Peggy{/it})

pt: {sc}small{/sc} {sc}little{/sc} {sc}diminutive{/sc} {sc}minute{/sc} {sc}tiny{/sc} {sc}miniature{/sc} mean noticeably below average in size. {sc}small{/sc} and {sc}little{/sc} are often interchangeable, but {sc}small{/sc} applies more to relative size determined by capacity, value, number.
{sc}little{/sc} is more absolute in implication often carrying the idea of petiteness, pettiness, insignificance, or immaturity.

pt.t: a {it}minute{/it} amount of caffeine in the soda

pt: {sc}miniature{/sc} applies to an exactly proportioned reproduction on a very small scale.

shortdef: indicating small size and sometimes the state or quality of being familiarly known, lovable, pitiable, or contemptible —used of affixes (such as -ette, -kin, -ling) and of words formed with them (such as kitchenette, manikin, duckling), of clipped forms (such as Jim), and of altered forms (such as Peggy)
